intro: Collomia rawsoniana, commonly known as Rawson's fairybell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Collomia rawsoniana is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
